occurrences.text: Lord Jesus Christ here in Mark, if you turn to Mark chapter number 11, Mark chapter number 11, and notice we find that as we look here at this text that Jesus was walking, I believe, with courage. He was walking courageously. In verse number 27, the Bible says this, And they come again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests and the scribes and the elders. And notice what they say to him in verse 28, By what authority doest thou these things? And who gave thee this authority to do these things? Now, I find it quite interesting, of course, in Mark's gospel, chapter number 11, it only goes to chapter 16, he's nearing the end of his earthly ministry and soon going to the cross and all that will take place. But we find that he's walking and he's there, the Bible tells us in verse 27, in the temple, and he's walking there, he's walking out in the midst, the Pharisees, the scribes, the Sadducees, all the religious leaders, they all at this point in Christ's ministry, they were looking for any opportunity that they could possibly come up with to kill him, they hated him, they were, every time they were around, they were trying to find something to accuse him of, and we find that they take this approach in Mark 11, and they say, By what authority doest thou these things?
